meanings.definition: To communicate or indicate by a signal.
meanings.sent1: She signalled her friend to come over with a wave.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light signalled for the cars to stop.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel signalled to the other animals that the food was nearby.
meanings.sent4: The distant lighthouse signalled safety to the sailors lost at sea.
meanings.sent5: The teacher signalled the end of the lesson with a bell.

meanings.sent1: The referee signalled the start of the game with a whistle.
meanings.sent2: The smoke signalled a fire in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The magician signalled the beginning of his trick with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors signalled a celebration in the town square.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock signalled the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: To attract attention or make something known.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise signalled an emergency in the building.
meanings.sent2: The announcement signalled the launch of a new product.
meanings.sent3: The smell of fresh bread signalled the opening of the bakery.
meanings.sent4: The sudden silence signalled trouble in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The bright neon sign signalled the entrance to the store.
